website_summaries.verdict: Three Velcro straps keep the splint in place all night. Provides the right level of support for the foot.
pros: Customers like how the splint holds the foot in the proper position without placing too much stress on it
Can wear the splint on either foot
Good amount of padding for comfort
cons: A few customers say it's too bulky to wear all night
Some find the materials cause skin irritation

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the splint for plantar fasciitis to replace the one my doctor provided after it had gone through some wear and tear. The Procare splint did not fit well and did not stay in place throughout the night. Having worn a splint before and knowing how it should properly fit, I contacted the seller to return their product and was told, after contacting them twice before I got a response, that they do not accept returns. I highly recommend not buying this splint.
customer_reviews.author: Keriann Lavine-Anthony

customer_reviews.title: This is my fourth style of similar products.
customer_reviews.text: Like all the others I’ve tried, it takes a little getting used to. But this is the most comfortable and therefore works the best... gotta be willing to wear it for it to work.
customer_reviews.author: That Kat

customer_reviews.title: BEST SPLINT IN MY OPINION.
customer_reviews.text: Best splint I've used. Have had good results with one other brand, but my big toe was going numb. I have very slim legs & scrawny ankles, coupled with size 10 feet (Female). This splint holds my foot at the proper angle without putting heavy pressure on the top of my instep. I've had no problem sleeping with it but keep in mind I've been sleeping in a splint for more than a year. (I have plantar fasciitis coupled with arthritis.) I also like that it's safe for minimal walking. The other brand I've used seriously warns against it.
customer_reviews.author: Winkie

customer_reviews.title: covered In pet hair and dirt - "New condition"
customer_reviews.text: This is a medical device which I need immediately. Opened the package of the "New condition" item to find it covered in dirt and hair as pictured. Opened in a pet free environment and photos taken immediately.
customer_reviews.author: justdebnc

customer_reviews.title: Procare shipped immediately arrived next day
customer_reviews.text: I have injury, plantar, and tendon issue. Wow, this product, though it looks awkward, it is not. I fell right off to sleep immediately. ( I suffer from restless leg as well, and I was not bothered by it) I wonder if it is okay to wear during the day. I am going to try.
customer_reviews.author: B. read

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this splint to help with my plantar fasciitis. It seems well built, is comfortable to wear and my heel feels better in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Best we've found
customer_reviews.text: purchased several models and this one was by far the best. Most comfortable to sleep in and keep on by far.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to sleep in
customer_reviews.text: This boot definitely kept my foot at a 90 degree angle and the padding/straps around the foot were comfortable. My issue though was that because the boot is so bulky it forced me to hold my leg at a weird angle. If I laid flat on my back my foot was a little elevated by the boot forcing my knee to hyper extend. Woke up in the morning with an extremely sore hamstring and knee. Really wanted this to work but unfortunately it’s impossible to find a comfortable position to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Dean

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief and comfort!
customer_reviews.text: This boot definitely works for relieving plantar fasciitis pain. Better than the night splint I got from the podiatrist actually because your for cannot slip out of this boot and the stiff support won't allow your foot to point forward. It's bigger and warmer, which is the only downside to summer sleeping comfort, but worth it for the pain relief.
customer_reviews.author: Kennedy Family

customer_reviews.title: They really do help
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these boots. One I got from my Drs office, (I had a $42 copay on) the other I bought on Amazon. They are big and bulky. The pain relief isn't instant. But I feel the difference when I wear them all night versus when I don't. Aside from oofos recovery shoes they are the only thing that has helped in a consistent way.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Zaluk

customer_reviews.title: Stopped my foot pain
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like sleeping with this on, it really wasn’t very comfortable, but I only needed it for a couple of nights and the pain was gone. So it did what I needed it to do and while it wasn’t the most comfortable way to sleep, it was a quick remedy for my foot pain.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Brown

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: According to the use directions, there is supposed to be a wedge (hence the name Pro Wedge) to help with lift. The same item in gray through another seller has 2 wedges included. If this item is really a Pro Wedge, then where is the wedge that goes with it. I noticed that at night, my foot slips enough in the boot, that it isn’t as effective as it could be. A wedge under the toes would help immensely. I wish I had done a little more research on sellers, as this one is not only lacking, but much more expensive. It is going back.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID A CARROLL

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: Sure, it's uncomfortable and I usually take it off in the middle of the night...BUT...it worked! My intractable plantar faciitis is 95% gone. I tried stretches, rolling my foot on a ball, other night splints, PT, cortisone shot, nothing worked. I wear it to bed and sometimes during the day for a bit after working or other activities that involve some standing/walking, that's it. It's ugly, hot and it feels like someone is pushing up on the ball of your foot when you're trying to sleep, but, so what? No more "bunny hop" to the bathroom in the morning!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Ragan

customer_reviews.title: Offers relief for a heel injury
customer_reviews.text: Soft and comfy, if a little bulky, but definitely works as advertised. Would recommend for anyone struggling with plantar fasciitis (after asking your doctor, of course).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY COMFORTABLE ONLY AFTER A MODIFICATION FOR MY FOOT DROP
customer_reviews.text: I ended liking this as a support for my Foot Drop condition for sleeping and walking but ONLY after I modified the brace with additional padding near my Achilles tendon. Initially, the brace was NOT comfortable since it kept digging into my heel bunion to the point it hurt at night, but once I built up the surface of the brace where my Achilles tendon was located within the brace, it became EXTREMELY comfortable for both walking and sleeping. I cut a piece for foam and attached it to the brace using Velcro.
customer_reviews.author: Jace K.

customer_reviews.title: Great design and COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: So much more comfortable than my old plastic boot. Didn’t hold my foot in as flexed a position as my old boot but did the job. Plus it didn’t keep me up at night.
customer_reviews.author: CaroleGir

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable boot to sleep in
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable boot to sleep in, although straps are not designed well enough to keep my foot properly positioned- it allows too much movement. It works well enough to alleviate about 50% of my foot pain in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: J. HaleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Where’s the wedge?
customer_reviews.text: I’m confused, the instructions say insert the wedge after putting the boot on, but there is no wedge. And no returns.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Cacciola

customer_reviews.title: Helped me
customer_reviews.text: Wasnt sure I would be able to sleep in it, but actually had no problem sleeping. My foot felt better in about a week of using it nightly. Now I have it handy just in case but truly have not had to wear it for a while
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great for foot pain.
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my wife after she complained about Plantar Fasciitis. She liked and it was comfortable. Size does matter. Make sure you have the right foot size.
customer_reviews.author: Carl G.

customer_reviews.title: Best one out there!
customer_reviews.text: This really works if you want to wake up free from pain when you get up and out of bed. Not the best color but at least it is easy to find! Best part is having the wedge to secure the foot in place, in a 90deg angle.... makes all the difference!
customer_reviews.author: C. Calaquian

customer_reviews.title: Another prime delivery disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Product is great, but as usual anymore not delivered when promised. Prime membership and guaranteed delivery date is a disappointment again
customer_reviews.author: rjm

customer_reviews.title: better than my previous splint
customer_reviews.text: Although I still manage to point my toes while sleeping somewhat. This fits my foot but is too big on my ankle and calf even on the tightest setting. Better but not great if you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: sisterpine

customer_reviews.title: Too uncomfortable to sleep in comfortably.
customer_reviews.text: I found this item to be too warm and uncomfortable to sleep in. Though the fabric boot was soft didn't give me any pressure point discomfort, it caused too much friction with my sheets and made it hard to move around.
customer_reviews.author: book worm

customer_reviews.title: Great night splint.
customer_reviews.text: Great night splint for the price..It is good for large legs.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great for sleeping
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t know what to expect. This is very comfortable and not a problem for sleeping. The insert is impossible to attach after putting on the boot because of the Velcro so put it on before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Although this is the most comfortable brace, my doctor wasn’t a fan of it.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Fierro

customer_reviews.title: Plantar Fasciitis Relief
customer_reviews.text: Product came promptly and in great condition. Price was about 1/3 of same exact item if purchased at doctor's office. Seems to work as expected putting foot in neutral, at rest, position when wearing during sleep. Hope for great results with continued use. Lightweight and fits comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Lonita

customer_reviews.title: Magical product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely AMAZING only after 1 week! This product is MAGICAL! Relived my PF 50%. Looking forward to see how it does after 30 days. Will post an update. HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Cee

customer_reviews.title: hmm it's okay.
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my husband who suffers from plantar fasciitis, and he used it consistently for 2 months.. after that he just stopped using it. when i asked him how it was, he said, "it might be of help when/if i have a bad episode, maybe".. he didn't really feel any significant help from it.
customer_reviews.author: Daria A 💕

customer_reviews.title: Pain Relief
customer_reviews.text: I like that its comfortable to sleep with and in the morning it's easy for me to walk. It relieves the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This ProWedge device just does not work to keep my foot and leg at even close to a 90 degree angle. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Ane Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It is surprising comfortable to sleep in. I was sceptical that it would work, but it really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 9 as the size of the one from the hospital. Short. Should have gone size larger. ☹
customer_reviews.author: cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Little expensive for cardboard and cloth basic ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Little expensive for cardboard and cloth basic unit. Wears out fairly fast. Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: CarmiJim

customer_reviews.title: the velcro doesn't catch like it should
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced, and eventually, after repeated use, the velcro doesn't catch like it should. Other than that, it does what the doctor wants.
customer_reviews.author: Garby

customer_reviews.title: This doesn't work and fits poorly
customer_reviews.text: This ill-fitting boot did not stay on properly no matter how many times I adjusted it. It's awkward, cumbersome, and made my foot feel worse.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Hurt more than helped
customer_reviews.text: Not for someone with edema or sensitive skin. Keeping it against the possibility it will find some use, but not in bed as yet. Back to Prevalon boots.
customer_reviews.author: Renard

customer_reviews.title: Sizing off
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. But the sizing is confusing. And it is too big to hold my heel securely.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be helping. Noticed a difference the first ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be helping. Noticed a difference the first time using this product. Much less pain when getting out of bed. Only downfall I see is with summer approaching it may be too warm.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing to bed at night. Very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I had the other boot that had straps and they were digging into my foot, not with this product, extremely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Coulton

customer_reviews.title: Best night boot
customer_reviews.text: The only boot to sleep in when plantar fasciitis rears its ugly head. Comfortable and allows whole calf and ankle to relax while keeping the foot stretched.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good fix
customer_reviews.text: The ProCare boot works perfectly and helped me with my Plantar Fasciitis problem.
customer_reviews.author: English

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than expected
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable for sleeping in, I like the soft material which is more like a blanket for your foot!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for sleeping with the pain. Pain decreases by wearing each night. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: stella

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to sleep in...if you have to have a boot
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Morell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable splint. Securely holds the foot at a 90 deg angle.
customer_reviews.author: Mikeymo

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Not as much support as the one from the Dr.'s office, but can walk and sleep in it and it provides more support than not wearing anything. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Helpful, Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Much more comfortable than the StraXXburg Sock (always brutal on my big toe), and very comfortable while sleeping. Has helped a great deal in keeping my foot in a firm position without being awoken for lack of circulation or "hot spots" because of poor manufacturing. Oh, and it helps that whole plantar fasciitis issue as well, which is the whole reason the contraption exists. You won't regret it, and your investment in your feet will actually help.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lankford

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Same orthotic that I received in my podiatrist's office, but much cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: RMH_SoCo

customer_reviews.title: Great product. The intense pain I experienced in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The intense pain I experienced in the morning or when I got up in the middle of the night was virtually gone after wearing it for one night. It's fairly comfortable, just takes a little getting used to. My plantar fasciitis is not gone but it was much worse before I started wearing this night splint. I bought another brand which looked similar and was even slightly more comfortable, but I did not get the same level of pain relief with it. Hard to say why. Highly recommend an worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl B

customer_reviews.title: Really light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: It helped keep my foot immobilized while sleeping. Really light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria A. Sola

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to take on and off during the night when ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this for a month now. It is easy to take on and off during the night when I get up to use the bathroom. Not uncomfortable to sleep with.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy L.

customer_reviews.title: Pain in gone!
customer_reviews.text: The pain in my heel is going away after a lot of discomfort after wearing the night splint faithfully. It is a wonder alternative to surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Milton J Vander Molen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Some nights felt more heavy and cumbersome but most nights was fine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... plastic boot by 100 percent and sleeping is much better.
customer_reviews.text: It beats the hard plastic boot by 100 percent and sleeping is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Weyer

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great to relieve chronic foot pain from running. Easy to slide into and take off. Much lighter than previous model.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Daly

customer_reviews.title: Better than other remedies.
customer_reviews.text: These helped reduce the foot pain from the first use. They are bulky, like wearing lightweight ski boots, especially because I wear two of them at night, but the results are worth the inconvenience. The internal removable footpads do sometimes shift, so these really need more Velcro to hold them in place. But overall the boots are worth the money. Spent five months previously in PT and got cortisone shots but neither worked as well as the Prowedge boots.
customer_reviews.author: Charatza

customer_reviews.title: best velvet brace easy to sleep with
customer_reviews.text: i can only compare to a few with straps to the toe or ball of feet that are cumbersome to sleep with and 1/2 the time slip down so dont benefit. so far after 5 nights, i can attest to this velvet warm soft but firm boot that the other foot can cuddle up and toss and turn with as it normally would aka better sleep and it holds the shape the entire night. very well made, you can feel every penny invested in this one vs the rest. kudos to the inventors.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf

customer_reviews.title: The boot does help in the mornings
customer_reviews.text: The boot does help in the mornings. Walking is not nearly as painful when I get up. Before standing, I do some leg stretches each morning. I've been wearing the boot to bed for about a month. I've had this bout of pf for about 6 weeks and know it's going to take months before it's over. As it's winter time, I'm wearing socks to bed with the boot. The boot does keep my foot warm and cozy but it may be a bit much once the weather warms up. Sizing: I wear an 8 1/2 EE Women's shoe. The Medium boot is plenty large enough.
customer_reviews.author: MJinVA

customer_reviews.title: It REALLY does help!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the recommendation from my friend since we have similar extreme heel pain issues. I just got it in the mail yesterday and wore it last night and I did noticed a difference in the morning during my first few steps out of bed which are usually extremely painful to the point I can barely walk. Wearing good shoes with inserts to cushion my heel, icing my feet and now wearing this has definitely helped the healing process for my poor feet. (I used to be a runner and walk many miles a week with my dogs until my heel pain became too much just a couple of months ago.) I highly recommend this night splint.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: It's expensive. But it's worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other night splints -- hard to use, and not very comfortable. This one is easy to use and relatively comfortable -- so you are more likely to use it. I wish it were cheaper, but... worth the money. I like it enough that I'm buying a second. Update: After wearing a pair of them nightly for about 6 weeks, my fasciitis is GREATLY improved -- I can walk around without my heels hurting. I plan to keep using them for several more months at least, but the gist is: They work. They're expensive, but definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Connor

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I've had slight plantar fasciitis pain for years now....mostly in the morning or when sitting for a long time. But a couple of months ago, I awoke with it being so bad I could barely walk. Even after doing stretches I was limping and had to go down stairs sideways. I had huge improvement after wearing this for a few nights. I can now walk without limping and go straight down the stairs. I'm still wearing it for now, because I don't want to slide back to where I was. Well worth getting this!
customer_reviews.author: KEMCB

customer_reviews.title: good support
customer_reviews.text: Dr. prescribed a size for my foot, but eventually bought a second, a size smaller, wanted a tighter fit. Found that the ankle brace works better if the hook and loop end is wrapped around the material that looks like it is there to protect from the top strap's hook and loops. Wrap it as close to the opposite edge as is comfortable. Is tighter that way, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Fuhrman

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced a night splint with this product. What an improvement. Wow! And a great price compared to other sites.
customer_reviews.author: boxermom

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Tried adjusting several times over several nights. No matter what I tried would not stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Nanook

customer_reviews.title: It worked!
customer_reviews.text: The ProCare ProWedge Plantar Fasciitis brace worked very well for my wife. It took some getting used to, but began to give her relief by the 2nd night she wore it. After a couple of weeks, she was able to continue healing without using the brace. I believe this is a viable way for many people to get some relief from planta fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: T. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Buy this sooner than later! You’ll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.text: This brace has been a game changer! I had ankle surgery five weeks ago. The boot that I am normally in was too cumbersome and highly uncomfortable at night. I use this brace (without the wedge) while sitting around or going to sleep in the bed . It’s comfortable and supports your foot. I wish I had thought it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: HNW

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This works great for keeping a broken foot still at night. It isn’t real heavy like the walking boot I was put in to heal. The walking boot made my hip hurt at night. Sleeping without the boot made my foot hurt. This boot solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: I needed something more rigid
customer_reviews.text: This product is way to flexible if the purpose is to demobilize the foot pursuant to plantar fasciitis. The product is very easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Soft comfortable splint that fits well
customer_reviews.text: Soft comfortable splint that fits well. Velcro closures stick together tightly and look like they will last for awhile. Additional footpad gives extra tendon stretch. I recommend just starting with the boot in a 90 degree flexion pattern before using the foot pad so as not to overstretch initially.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I had Achilles Repair surgery on Dec 20th. I was in casts for six weeks and then graduated to "the boot." When sleeping I wear this. I've used other products similar to this in the past, but this one is my favorite. It's comfortable and fits great.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chiesa

customer_reviews.title: ... one actually stabilizes your foot in dorsiflex position much better. Comfortable to sleep in
customer_reviews.text: Tried different brand for a year but this one actually stabilizes your foot in dorsiflex position much better. Comfortable to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Harpell

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and secure
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to wear while I sleep at night to protect my foot after surgery. It keeps the foot at a right angle and is soft and comfortable while having the stiffness needed to protect.
customer_reviews.author: Cy Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Dorsiwedge Review
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this one that I just purchased, but have used the same one before, it just got worn out. If you have plantar faciaitis (sp ?) and are faithful in wearing the boot, you should experience great relief. It is quite large and not so "attractive", especially when combined with the wrist braces for my carpal tunnel.....:-P Thankfully that was fixed but I have been told the surgery for PF is not always successful and this boot does the trick for me...... hopefully for you too!
customer_reviews.author: Cherri

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & supportive night brace.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality for good price.This fits comfortably & is soft enough to sleep in. I was afraid it would be too hard, but it is very comfortable when sleeping. I also use it if I'm just sitting during the day, & it is very nice & doesn't put any strain on my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M Fredrich

customer_reviews.title: Good brace
customer_reviews.text: Fit very well, perfect to stretch the muscle and keep pain down. And they are very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Decelles

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Slides out of position during the course of the night, rendering it totally and utterly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line
customer_reviews.text: This is the same grade wedge that the specialists recommend for treating plantar fasciitis. It is easier to use on the left foot but can be used on either foot. I bought it for my right foot and it's a little awkward to wrap but not difficult. It keeps your foot at the proper angle so that tears in your plantar fascii have time to heel in the best position. I would recommend it to anyone who suffers from the agony of PF/heel spurs. It is worth the money and better than the cheaper splints available at local drug stores (believe me - I've tried them all!).
customer_reviews.author: A.R. Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Worked after only two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Although quite bulky, it was uncomfortable and did not stretch out my calves at night. Given there was not any stretching involved, I did not think it would work but it did. I am a physician and this was recommended by podiatry consult as the best model to get. Amazon was cheaper than buying it any other way
customer_reviews.author: S. Pattison

customer_reviews.title: however it is very annoying and unpleasant to wear at night
customer_reviews.text: This works to help reduce heel pain, however it is very annoying and unpleasant to wear at night. I wanted to try something else but other braces that I have found have the same negatives AND they have caused other foot pain. This product works and does not cause any pain, but it is a nuisance to wear.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Confort is of utmost importance
customer_reviews.text: Being confortable makes me want to use it every night
customer_reviews.author: Melvin T. Kohler

customer_reviews.title: Helps Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: This boot is about the only thing that helps my plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: D. Koe

customer_reviews.title: Plantar Fascitis relief !
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and relieves the foot/heel pain when getting out of bed in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This splint is comfortable to sleep in
customer_reviews.text: This splint is comfortable to sleep in. I'm wearing it for plantar fasciitis. However I've found that it doesn't provide enough stretch, and doesn't keep my foot at a 90 degree angle, even with the wedge. I think it's better than not wearing anything, but it's not providing the help I hoped for, especially considering the price. Additionally, I think this is double the price that it should be. I wear a size 8-8.5 womens size, and the medium splint seems to be the right size.
customer_reviews.author: BarbieA1

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit, comfortable at night. Works great at managing pain.
customer_reviews.author: BeckiLyn

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I don’t usually write reviews but these are so comfortable! I’ve tried many other night splints and was tearing them off during the night.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get used to sleep with, but very effective about reducing the morning, get-up-and-go pain.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality boot.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my mom after she broke her leg and was at risk of her ankle locking up in a downward position. It was recommended by her physical therapist and is a good quality, comfortable boot. The straps holds well too. Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: It is lightweight and easy to turn in my sleep and not hot
customer_reviews.text: This splint works! I am finally able to sleep without pain due to my plantar facitiitis. It is lightweight and easy to turn in my sleep and not hot. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Retta

customer_reviews.title: Not a helpful product
customer_reviews.text: Probably more comfortable than other sleeping boots, but not effective. Would like to return.....
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: not easy to sleep with
customer_reviews.text: Works well, however really bulky, not easy to sleep with, but possible.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa J. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Caused Numbness
customer_reviews.text: It barely goes around my calf, and such it cuts off my circulation mid night and my toes go numb. So back to the hard brace i already had I go! It was a huge waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Harper

customer_reviews.title: To soon to tell
customer_reviews.text: I understand that these may have to be worn at night for almost a year before any major results will be seen. Stay tuned....
customer_reviews.author: Barny

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable. I can't sleep in this brace. I gave it away.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working so far!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom and she shared with me that within days she felt the difference... She wants one for the other foot now :D
customer_reviews.author: Leslie De Leon

product_meta.title: Procare ProWedge Plantar Fasciitis Night Splint - Medium
product_meta.description: Size:MediumContoured posterior shell provides passive dorsiflexion to address plantar fasciitis and achilles tendonitis. Removable liner may be washed for patient hygiene. Fits right or left foot. Male shoe size 6-1/2 to 9-1/2; female 7 to 10. Night Splint
feature_bullets: Designed to keep the foot at a 90-degree angle to the shinbone, which places a sustained stretch on the plantar fascia
Features a soft padded, contoured posterior shell that provides passive dorsiflexion to address plantar fasciitis and Achilles tendonitis
Prolonging this stretch overnight helps hold the plantar fascia in a better position for healing
Secured with 3 Velcro straps, keeping it in fastened the entire night; Features a removable liner that can be washed
Universal fit allows the ProCare ProWedge Plantar Fasciitis Night Splint to be worn on either the left or right foot

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
